title: Interview 001 Analysis: Quantitative Metrics and Qualitative Insights

attachments.extracted_content:
- [[Interview-Metadata]] [[001 Interview]]
    - (The below should be filled with True False depending on what is found in interview)
    - [[Direct_Blast_Experience_False]]
    - Injury_From_Blast:: False
    - Code: Response-Migration Ideation:: True
    - Placebuilding_Ideation:: False
    - Know_Someone_Hurt:: False
    - Home_Damaged:: False
    - Office_Damaged:: False
- [[History/Background]] [[001 Interview]]
    - Can you tell me about your history with entrepreneurship?
        - Most of my family is entrepreneurial. [[Code: Background-Entrepreneurial Family]] They have their own businesses Waiting for others to finish their work so you can work on your part.
    - Can you tell me about your decision making process when you decided to start your own busine /Next Milestones?
        - Three subjects already done, content is done. The application still has problems with IOS version. Android version is complete. Few bugs. When I test it on my phone.
        - Customers Start something and it's not finished it'll give a bad reputation for a product. Once it's out there - get reviews and start from there. Minor reviews and make stuff better. Change it totally.
        - No technical background with family. House renovation business.
- [[Ethnographic Questions]] [[001 Interview]]
    - Gender:: Male
    - Age:: 35
    - Age-Range:: 35-45
    - Origin:: Akkar
    - Residence:: Tripoli
    - Family_Income_Bracket:: Upper Middle
- [[Entrepreneurial Intent Questions]] [[001 Interview]]
    - EI_Score:: 35
    - EI_Employment_Status:: Self employed
    - If I find the correct project, then sure
    - My professional goal is becoming an entrepreneur (to run your own business)
        - I like my independence  [[Code: Value-Independence]] 
    - I’ve got the firm(strong) intention to start a firm some day [[Code: Entrepreneurial-Ideation]] I've tried several other projects, several of them flopped. I'm learning from them[[Code: Learning-From Failure]], the intention is there. epends on the project and if it's worthy of the time. It's worthy of the time when you get a good reaction from the clients. For example, I've done Eid Parade - a festival 2 years ago. Clients didn't really like it. They didn't like to visit it on the eid, didn't work out on the date they wanted.
    - If you're trying to make your own business, you need to have clients. If your clients don't like it it's a flop. 
- [[Impact of Event Scale IES-R]] [[001 Interview]]
    - IES-R_Score:: 39
    - IES-R_Interpretation:: 37+: This is high enough to suppress your immune system's functioning (even 10 years after an impact event)
    - IES-R_Hyper_Arousal:: 11
    - IES-R_Avoidance:: 17
    - IES-R_Intrusion:: 21
    - Do you worry about your economic future?
        - Yes, when you're alone it's ok, w/family it's hard [[Code: Family-Responsibility]]
    - My country is affected by it one way or another, financially/politically other ways. You get affected by the end. The big problems that keep me up is lack of economical hope for the problems we face now and no idea [[Code: Disempowerment]] for the foreseeable future.
    - Not due to the blast. Due to the aftermath. It's all related, not in a direct way. [[Code: Complex]] 
    - **Long term approach you take? **
        - Probably yes, unless I leave  [[Code: Response-Migration Ideation]] I had trouble falling asleep
    - I tried not to think about it
        - Attempt to live your life, hoping for the best. Then remember the lack of responsibility these people ruling your life. [[Code: Feeling-Anger Corruption]] Then you remember they destroyed half the city with no responsibility. Why am I still here? [[Code: Disempowerment]] [[Code: Response-Migration Ideation]]
        - Everything is quite connected and not in a direct fashion. [[Code: Complex]] 
    - For something this big and no one admitting responsibility. This is something that really makes you angry.[[Code: Feeling-Injustice]] Can't describe it otherwise. It was like it was an act of god, it was still someone's responsibility. Someone should be accountable. After 7 months/a year - no one to blame. I mean come on, we're not kids!
    - No one was held responsible. [[Code: Feeling-Injustice]] 
    - **I avoided letting myself get upset when I thought about it or was reminded of it **
        - At first no, currently yes. Started 2 months after the explosion Pictures about it popped into my mind [[Code: Intrusive thoughts]]
        - Still get the news, still see the suffering. Still see the damage when you see Beirut. When you go to the street and you see the people suffering and you remember that there was a huge explosion and the people suffering and no one did anything about it. [[Code: Government-Anger]] It's the lack of management [[Code: Feeling-Anger Corruption]] that came after it - that triggers the anger. 
    - "what do you think about that?" 
        - I don't know. I attempt not to think about it more than I should [[Code: Response-Avoidance]], because if I do I'll definitely leave the next day.[[Code: Response-Avoidance]] [[Code: Response-Migration Ideation]]
        - Other things kept making me think about the blast
            - The economical crisis basically. [[Code: Financial]] We got a lot of aid after the explosion. It was for the surrounding areas to benefit. Problem is corruption/lack of management. [[Code: Feeling-Anger Corruption]] 
            - We lost most of the help that came. We didn't see most of it. [[Code: Feeling-Despair]][[Code: Feeling-Anger Corruption]]
            - So a lot of people didn't benefit. [[Code: Feeling-Anger Corruption]] Within the economic impact-you can see it in the bill you get from the supermarket each day.
    - Any reminder brought back feelings about it 
        - Whenever I go to Beirut. I see devastation. We're here where to now? - "answer?"- I'm saying, if this doesn't wake up the public [[Code: Value-Agency]]Raise and start some kind of revolution then nothing will. [[Code: Ideation-Revolutionary]] [[Revolutionary_Ideation_True]] [[Code: Political Anger]] 
          People are dead, 300000 families are homeless yet nothing happened. [[Code: Extrinsic]]
- [[Resilience BRCS]][[001 Interview]]
    - BRCS_Score:: 12
    - BRCS_Interpretation:: Low Resilient Coping: 4-13
    - **I look for creative ways to alter difficult situations.**
        - I look for creative ways to alter difficult situations. 
            - I try to find solutions as much as I can.  [[Code: Silver-Linings]]I try to find alternative solutions if something doesn't work out. Related to my personality. Do what you have to do. I know what I have to do today and I do it.[[Code: Personality Trait]] I hope it will lead to something good and so I do it. If it doesn't I will try to do something else. Try to plan ahead. I hope it will lead to something good and so I do it. If it doesn't I will try to do something else.[[Code: Preparation]] Try to plan ahead.
        - Regardless of what happens to me, I believe I can control my reaction to it.
            - Well I hope I can - haven't really tried it. Depends on the actual problem, if it's a really big issue I'm not sure how I will react.[[Code: Feeling-Self Doubt]]
            - Usually I'm more composed [[Code: Social-Awareness]] and I'm not sure I actively look for ways to replace the losses I encounter in life. x
        - I actively look for ways to replace the losses I encounter in life.
            - I'm not sure if I do it. Probably ask my wife, she knows me best. Don't handle loss very well. [[Code: Value-Self knowledge]] [[Code: Extrinsic]]
    - How have you been coping after the blast?
        - Day by day. Live day by day hoping for the best. [[Code: Value-Survival]] You don't see a clear path and you hope for the best.
- [[Post Traumatic Growth Index]][[001 Interview]]
    - PTGI_Score:: 76
    - PTGI_Average:: 3.619
    - PTGI_Appreciation of life:: 14
    - PTGI_Spiritual Enhancement:: 8
    - PTGI_Relating to others:: 21
    - PTGI_New Possibilities:: 16
    - PTGI_Personal Strength:: 17
    - I changed my priorities about what is important in life.
        - Basically we were living day by day. Now I am cutting down on all the risks. Being more effective. Nothing is going to be risky anymore, so you have to plan correctly. No room for error now. [[Code: Realistic]] 
        - Not just the blast, the whole situation in Lebanon. Not allowed to make mistakes anymore. When you don't have to take risks, you don't do projects. Entrepreneurship is about taking risks and following your dreams. [[Code: Entrepreneurial-Ideation]]
    - **How are you balancing hope/projects and not taking risks? **
        - - there is no financial risk, just some emotional risks. [[Code: Risk]][[Code: Financial]] And finish the project and launch it and see what happens.[[Code: Value-Agency]] Most of the risk is done before. 
        - I feel a little luckier than most. [[Code: Feeling-Gratitude]]
    - **2 I have a greater appreciation for the value of my own life : **4
        - My own perspective yes. The whole situation doesn't give you the perspective. Wait an hour and a half for gas and get nothing. It doesn't help you think to appreciate the value of your own life. You realize they don't value your life. You know you're good, your family loves you, important to them. The country doesn't allow you to live your own life. [[Code: Feeling-Stuck]] 
        - You think maybe I'm not that important.  When you can't really find baby formula for your kid. how do you think that will make you feel. It's not because you lack the money - it's because it's not there. [[Code: Disempowerment]] [[Code: Feeling-Sad]]
          The rich and the poor are battling the same issues. [[Code: Social-Awareness]] the first time in history I think. Both, angry at the govornment and it makes them think their life has no worth. Some people think they have worth and they have to fight to get their rights back. 
        - Number of suicides getting higher because they don't have the mental stability...etc. [[Code: Social-Awareness]]
    - What is the difference between the "people that get angry and the people who get defeated?" 
        - Depends on the situation. People who are well educated, had some good upbringing. Didn't have that many problems, or had problems and conquer them they are more ready to fight for their survival. Some people who are educated, and have too much on their plate, can't handle it. They lose hope. When everything comes together, you break. Doesn't matter who you are or what you're doing, if everything bottles up, you break. [[Code: Situation-Overwhelming]]
    - I developed new interests.
        - Revivied an old interest, gardening and animal raising. To feel relaxed, and might be a necessity later on. Never know better to be prepare. [[Code: Response-Survivalist]] [[Code: Preparation]]
    - I have a better understanding of spiritual matters.
        - In a broader context I'd say yes. As relates to corona, no. You get to think about the bigger picture. What plan God has for you, where you're going to be headed, do you need to worry about it or is it already taken care of? [[Code: Spirituality-Reliance on God]] [[Code: Spirituality]]
        - "Do you need to worry about it or is it already taken care of" Sha3rawis famous speaches: you don't need to worry you need to work. "Al qulubu ttawakkal wal jawarih ta3mal" - (the hearts rely on god and the limbs get to work) Depend on God to ease/provide, let the work do the results. [[Code: Spirituality-Reliance on God]] [[Code: Spirituality]]
    - I more clearly see that I can count on people in times of trouble.
        - The whole new crisis allowed you to filter friends/close ones. You know now who you can really depend on. [[Code: Value-True friends]] 
    - I established a new path for my life.
        - I'm starting to. Finding alternative methods to survive. Trying to change the circumstances of living situation. Everything is connected. Farming is just hobby for now.
    - I have a greater sense of closeness with others.
    - You bond with people more. Usually crisis brings people together. [[Code: Bonding]][[Code: Silver-Linings]]
    - I am more willing to express my emotions.
      
        - Not an extrovert. I'm not shy about expressing my opinions. Depends on the emotion. Joy happiness - I like to share. When it comes to fear/sadness I tend to bottle it up. [[Code: Value-Privacy]]
    - Trying to, not easy to do. Try your hardest at the end[[Code: Value-Hope]] [[Code: Value-Agency]], there are things that you are simply unable to do. "What are you unable to do? " - Like I said, current problems we're living in. Doesn't matter if you have money or not, there are some things that are not there so you can't really fix it. Will your best to do good/provide, things start to mess up.
    - I am better able to accept the way things work out.
        - Yes, I think I am. I know there is a bigger picture, you have your doubts in your stomach and your guts this is how it has to be it is going to be good.** "how do you know it's going to be good"**. - this is how it's supposed to be, 3asa an takrahu shay2ann wahiyyah kheirun lakum.** "Do you really believe that?"** - you get doubts, and I believe that. "What helps you over come the doubts" - luck, something shows you that a big loss was not such a loss. - previous experiences.
    - New opportunities are available which wouldn't have been otherwise.
        - Currently it's hard to spot the opportunities, and I know they are there. You listen to people/ see their problems.
    - I have more compassion for others.
        - How did it develop? With the current situation you have more of an understanding of the hardship they are enduring. You know how much people earn and what troubles they have to get by each day. You are more apprehensive of their situation. Doesn't have to be spoken about, it's visible. There. You can see it (how much people earn).
    - I put more effort into my relationships. 
        - Lockdown did - when you're locked down with someone it brings everything up. You take your time to solve the problems to pass the time. [[Code: Response-Patience]]  You don't have a choice [[Code: No-agency]], or anything to do other than that (work on relationships) I am more likely to try to change things which need changing. (sigh) - I get too attached to things. One of my defaults. I can't, not that I don't want to, I just can't.
    - I have a stronger religious faith.
        - it's always been there, when you start to have this many problems you lose faith or be more religious. I'm heading the other way. [[Code: Spirituality]]
        - Would you have preferred to develop religiosity in other ways? - 
            - when you don't have any problems you tend to lose track of faith. [[Code: Spirituality-Needs challenges]] [[Code: Spirituality]]
    - I discovered that I'm stronger than I thought I was.
        - I have my doubts, eventually I came over them. [[Code: Feeling-Self Doubt]]
    - I learned a great deal about how wonderful people are.
        - (sigh) - Yeah... You know people more, some for the best and some for the worst. [[Code: Response-Judgement]]
    - Did you change the people you keep in your life?
        - you can't really say change, some people just fade out.
    - I better accept needing others.
        - Try to be independent as much as possible. [[Code: Value-Independence]] Try to do it myself, if I'm unable - then I turn to someone, not the first step I take
- [[Rumination]][[001 Interview]]
    - Intrusive_Rumination_Score:: 31
    - Deliberate_Rumination_Score:: 36
        - I thought about whether the experience has changed my beliefs about the world.
            - If this big impact didn't result in anything, then a lot of things need to change. [[Code: Feeling-Hopeless]]
        - I thought about what the experience might mean for my future.
            - Staying/leaivng that's the basically the impact I'm concerned about. If I'm going to stay here what should I do to support my family in the correct way to avoid stuff like that from affecting them. [[Code: Response-Self Protection]]
        - I forced myself to deal with my feelings about the event. 
            - Not forcing myself, eventually you deal with things.
        - **Do you see a role for entrepreneurs in Lebanon given the current situation?**
            - For each crisis, opportunities rise. [[Code: Silver-Linings]]For these crises opportunities can be found by entrepreneurs and work with it. You find a need and there must be solutions to the problems. [[Code: Entrepreneurship-Solution to problems]]
        - Are entrepreneurs in Lebanon able to work to solve these problems?
            - A lot of potential brilliant minds, if there's no support it'll be hard to maintain. If not funded, supported by any means that will bring your project to ruin. [[Code: Response-Suggest to fund projects]] Loose hope - that's bad. [[Code: Feeling-Hopeless]]
            - Lot of people tried something here, and ended up bankrupt / failed. and just left the country. [[Code: Response-Migration Ideation]]
        - Can you tell me a little about what has been supporting you personally and professionally since the blast?
            - Family, basically. [[Code: Security]] We still have a secure income. [[Code: Financial]] Which is good. Income is not dependable right now, so... Family/friends. are the main support. In a sense we're already far from the blast itself. So it's good, I think
        - How do you see personal values / ways you want to be in the world. Values and the conversation?
            - Values like honesty, courage, perspective. For these you have to be honest with yourself, needs/plans, are you willing to do what it takes to achieve them. You have to have courage to start. Trust me you have to have a lot of courage to start these days.[[Code: Value-Courage]] You have to have a lot of courage to start. some of them will succeed. They will probably make a difference somewhere. All depends on the perspective. If you have different priorities. You won't follow with you dreams on the correct path. [[Code: Vision]]
        - **Where do values come from? 
            - Some are born with it, others you acquire through life. Some are born with it, and loose it in the end. Some are really courageous, after being knocked down a few times they tend to lack faith in their actions and start to fear. [[Code: Value-Courage]] [[Code: Feeling-Sad]]

messages.content:
I'll analyze Interview 001 according to the requested format.

<antThinking>This interview needs careful analysis of both quantitative metrics and qualitative themes, with special attention to rumination patterns and entrepreneurial response mechanisms. I'll use the analysis tool to help process some of the metrics before creating the full analysis.</antThinking>
```
Analysis Tool outputs from the web feature preview aren’t yet supported on mobile.
```



I'll proceed with the manual analysis based on the interview content:

QUANTITATIVE METRICS:
```json
{
  "interview_id": "001",
  "metadata": {
    "age": 35,
    "gender": "Male",
    "location": "Tripoli",
    "direct_blast_experience": false,
    "prior_trauma_mentioned": true
  },
  "formal_scores": {
    "ies_r": {
      "total": 39,
      "intrusion": 21,
      "avoidance": 17,
      "hyperarousal": 11
    },
    "ptgi": {
      "total": 76,
      "appreciation": 14,
      "spirituality": 8,
      "relationships": 21,
      "possibilities": 16,
      "strength": 17
    },
    "deliberate_rumination": 36,
    "intrusive_rumination": 31,
    "ei_score": 35,
    "brcs_score": 12
  },
  "derived_metrics": {
    "emotional_mentions": {
      "anger": 4,
      "fear": 1,
      "hope": 2,
      "despair": 2,
      "gratitude": 1
    },
    "processing_mechanisms": {
      "deliberate_rumination_examples": 8,
      "avoidance_mentions": 3,
      "meaning_making_attempts": 6
    },
    "future_orientation": {
      "migration_mentions": 4,
      "entrepreneurial_intentions": 3,
      "commitment_to_place": 1
    }
  }
}
```

THEMATIC INSIGHTS:
```json
{
  "interview_id": "001",
  "processing_patterns": {
    "deliberate_rumination": {
      "examples": [
        "Being more effective. Nothing is going to be risky anymore, so you have to plan correctly",
        "Finding alternative methods to survive",
        "You know now who you can really depend on"
      ],
      "key_quotes": [
        "Al qulubu ttawakkal wal jawarih ta3mal - (the hearts rely on god and the limbs get to work)",
        "For each crisis, opportunities rise"
      ],
      "triggers": [
        "Financial insecurity",
        "Family responsibility",
        "System failure"
      ],
      "barriers": [
        "Overwhelming situation",
        "Lack of support",
        "Resource constraints"
      ]
    },
    "prior_experience": {
      "types_mentioned": [
        "Failed entrepreneurial projects",
        "Previous crisis navigation"
      ],
      "influence_quotes": [
        "I've tried several other projects, several of them flopped. I'm learning from them",
        "luck, something shows you that a big loss was not such a loss. - previous experiences"
      ],
      "usage_patterns": [
        "Risk assessment",
        "Failure learning",
        "Expectation management"
      ]
    },
    "growth_indicators": {
      "value_shifts": [
        "Greater emphasis on planning",
        "Increased focus on relationships",
        "Spiritual deepening"
      ],
      "action_patterns": [
        "Developing backup plans",
        "Investing in relationships",
        "Exploring self-sufficiency (gardening)"
      ],
      "supporting_quotes": [
        "Now I am cutting down on all the risks",
        "The whole new crisis allowed you to filter friends/close ones",
        "Revivied an old interest, gardening and animal raising"
      ]
    }
  },
  "entrepreneurial_themes": {
    "motivation_sources": [
      "Independence",
      "Problem-solving",
      "Community impact"
    ],
    "challenge_responses": [
      "Risk reduction",
      "Alternative solution seeking",
      "Support network leveraging"
    ],
    "support_systems": [
      "Family",
      "Stable income",
      "Close friends"
    ]
  }
}
```

Key Findings:

1. This entrepreneur shows a sophisticated balance between deliberate rumination (score: 36) and intrusive rumination (score: 31), with deliberate rumination slightly higher despite significant impact (IES-R: 39).

2. The processing pattern reveals active meaning-making through multiple channels:
   - Religious/spiritual framework ("Al qulubu ttawakkal...")
   - Practical action (gardening, planning)
   - Social filtering and strengthening

3. Notable tension between:
   - Entrepreneurial drive and risk management
   - Place attachment and migration consideration
   - Hope and systemic constraints

4. Strong evidence of experience-enabled processing:
   - References to learning from past failures
   - Ability to contextualize current challenges
   - Integration of spiritual and practical coping

Would you like me to elaborate on any of these aspects or provide additional analysis in a specific area?
